title: Tunisia Diaries: This is the bike I’m riding to Tunisia
content:
Cyclist
Tunisia Diaries: This is the bike I’m riding to Tunisia 

In case you missed it, I’m about to set off on a 16-day bikepacking trip to Tunisia, a distance of 2,311km. And this is the bike I’ll be riding – a Ribble Gravel Ti Hero. It boasts an elegant titanium frameset which some eye-catching tech, as well as comfortable geometry which is ideal for riding day after day.  

The Hero is Ribble’s top spec Gravel Ti offering and features a SRAM Force AXS 1× groupset. I’ve swapped out the stock Enve Foundation AG28 carbon 650b wheels and Halo GXD tyres for some Mavic Allroad 700c wheels and Challenge gravel grinder tyres. 

Via Ribble’s online BikeBuilder this build costs £4,166 including the titanium cages, bottles and pannier rack. There aren’t many changes from the original spec, except for the tyres and wheels.  

I’ve also had a bike-fit for this bike and here’s a list of everything I’m packing for the trip.

Ribble Gravel Ti details  

The Gravel Ti’s 3AL/2.5V titanium alloy frame uses triple-butted tubes to make sure it can be strong while minimising excess weight, and Ribble pairs it with Gravel Ti carbon forks.  

The bike comes with a SRAM Force AXS XPLR 1× groupset, which pairs a, 40t chainring with a 10-44 cassette. This offers an ideal range for tackling the steepest inclines while also allowing for some speed on the flat.  

The bars are LEVEL’s (Ribble’s in-house components brand) flared gravel riser design. They’re 420mm wide (which flare to 510mm at the drops) and feature a 20mm rise on the tops. Despite the increase in width, the flare on the drops is slight and offers great handling when descending on rough terrain. The increased stack afforded by the heightened tops means a comfortable all-day riding position is easy to achieve.  

Thanks to my bike-fit, I’ve swapped in an 80mm LEVEL stem (instead of the 100mm original) which has stopped me from overreaching and to relieve pressure on my hands.  

I’ve also swapped the Enve 650b wheels and Halo GXD tyres the standard build comes with for Mavic Allroad 700c and Challenge Gravel Grinder 38mm tyres for the combination of speed on asphalt without forgoing the ability to tackle some rough terrain.  

Challenge’s Gravel Grinder tyres compliment the wheels to offer a best of both worlds set up. The Gravel Grinders have a faster-rolling centre tread and some side-knobbles for proper off-road grip. They have just enough volume to give some comfort both on and off road but aren’t so big they will slow me down.

Tunisia Diaries: I’m cycling 2,311km so it’s time for a bike-fit

Ribble Gravel Ti accessories  

To transport all my stuff, the bike is fitted with a Ribble pannier rack which can take up to 25kg of luggage. The rack will have two Restrap large panniers on it, plus a frame bag and large bar bag.  

I’ve also added SQ lab pedals, some last minute fork cages and an Ergon SR Pro Women saddle.  

For full debrief of what I’m packing, check out the packing list here.  

Ribble Gravel Ti geometry  

The Gravel Ti is centred around stability, with a long wheelbase created in part by extended chainstays. That said, the bike’s head angle isn’t particularly relaxed, so together with the shorter stem I’ve installed, the handling is kept lively to ensure I can navigate technical sections of trail accurately. 

The frameset’s stack and reach figures aren’t too far removed from endurance road geometry, but by bringing the overall reach back with a shorter stem and using the riser bar to add some extra stack my ride position has ended up being far more upright to ensure it’s comfortable to maintain over the event distance. 

Ribble Gravel Ti ride so far  

So far on my training rides this bike has been a real charm to ride. It handles beautifully in the rough and is nimble on the road.  

I’ve taken it down muddy tracks, on speedy asphalt, the Surrey hills, the undulating narrow roads of Pembrokeshire and even the Thames Valley in torrential rain. It has proven itself to be really versatile, handling the variety of terrain I’ve tested it on capably. 

Most importantly, considering the trip I’m using it for, adding bags to the bike hasn’t resulted in anything negative happening to the ride experience. I’ve packed it full of the equipment I plan on using for the event (about 16kg’s worth) and as long as I pack it correctly, the bike’s handling is bang on.  

I like that the frame has tons of mounts, so can account for pretty much any bikepacking setup I want to use, while still allowing for panniers and mudguards too.  

The SRAM drivetrain and brakes have been functionally superb. The brakes are powerful enough to cope with me and my equipment, and are silent on operation, while gear changes are smooth and quick. The supplied gearing ratio means a slow and and steady churn up a steep hill while fully loaded is achievable, which I know will come in handy on the road.  

Ribble Gravel Ti verdict 

I think the Ribble Gravel Ti hits the mark as a capable and good-looking bike. If you want to ride on burlier terrain, the stock 650b wheels and tyres might be the way to go, but in my view, the Gravel Ti set up with 700c wheels and tyres is ideal for touring and exploring. That’s just as well, because that’s exactly what I’m off to do. 

The Hero build is not currently available on Ribble’s website, but via the brand’s BikeBuilder customisation tool you can create a similar setup.   

Ribble Gravel Ti specs: 

  • Price: £4,166 
  • Size: XXS, XS, S, M, L, XL  
  • Weight: 9.57kg (L) 
  • Frame: 3Al/2.5V Triple-Butted Titanium 
  • Fork: Carbon 
  • Wheels: Mavic Allroad 700c  
  • Tyres: Challenge Gravel Grinder 
  • Groupset: SRAM Force AXS XPLR 
  • Crankset: SRAM Force 1X D1 DUB Crankset, 40t 
  • Brakes: SRAM Force eTap AXS 
  • Handlebar: LEVEL Gravel Riser 
  • Rear derailleur: SRAM Force XPLR eTap AXS 
  • Cassette: SRAM XG 10-44 
  • Stem: 80mm Level 3 Carbon Look Road Stem 
  • Saddle: Ergon SR Pro Women 

Extra accessories:  

  • Bottle cages  
  • SQ labs SPD pedals   
  • Level 31.8 Pannier Seat Clamp Bundle 
  • 2x Ribble Team Bottle Smoke/Blue 600ml

author: Emma Cole | Features Writer
